item.title: Richard Van Noorden
item.description:
Le sigh. Paper shows that GPT-4 w/ Python can be used to ‚Äúfabricate data sets specifically designed to quickly produce false scientific evidence.‚Äù
As @cragcrest explains at LWON:
https://lastwordonnothing.com/2023/11/10/ai-is-a-terrifying-purveyor-of-bullshit-next-up-fake-science/ . Unsurprising, but still concerning.
(paper: https://jamanetwork.com/journals/jamaophthalmology/fullarticle/2811505?guestAccessKey=8bcd570b-7893-43e6-8ffb-aed1291337e9&utm_source=For_The_Media&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=ftm_links&utm_content=tfl&utm_term=110923 )

item.title: Julie Goldberg
item.description: Fascinating article! I had no idea that there is a global epidemic of #myopia, and that it is PREVENTABLE! #medical https://www.wired.com/story/taiwan-epicenter-of-world-myopia-epidemic/

item.title: Prof. Sam Lawler
item.description: I am excited that the editor reacted positively to my suggestion to use this beautiful/awful long-time-exposure photo of the sky full of satellite streaks: https://apod.nasa.gov/apod/ap220614.html My opinion piece about satellite pollution will get published eventually! Looking forward to proofs soon I hope...

item.title: The Gneech
item.description: Somebody just referred to capybaras as "guinea bigs" and I don't know what to do with this information.

item.title: Ars Technica
item.description: AI outperforms conventional weather forecasting for the first time: Google studyAI models may soon enable more accurate forecasts with higher speed and lower cost.https://arstechnica.com/science/2023/11/ai-outperforms-conventional-weather-forecasting-for-the-first-time-google-study/?utm_brand=arstechnica&utm_social-type=owned&utm_source=mastodon&utm_medium=social

item.title: Helen Branswell
item.description: The US House voted last night to attach a ban on gain-of-function research to legislation that would fund the NIH and other federal health agencies. Where it will go from here, though, is unclear. My @STAT colleague Sarah Owermohle reports. https://www.statnews.com/2023/11/15/gain-of-function-research-limit/

item.title: Kyle Harrington
item.description: I'm hiring a Software Engineer to work on ML for CryoET at the new CZ Imaging Institute in Redwood City, CA: https://grnh.se/8394d0275usWe're building a fantastic team at CZII. We have a supportive group of folks in a flat org structure and are all working hard to accelerate the future of imaging. The person who takes this position will have space for creativity and collaboration. I look forward to meeting you if I haven't already :)

item.title: Spencer LaVere Smith
item.description: Call out a quasiparticle that you're fond of. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_quasiparticles I appreciate configurons.

item.title: d a t green
item.description: Half-expecting government backbenchers to demand that we leave the jurisdiction of the UK Supreme Court.

item.title: Wolfie Christl
item.description: As part of a new report on digital advertising as a security threat published today by @johnnyryan and me (https://www.iccl.ie/wp-content/uploads/2023/11/Europes-hidden-security-crisis.pdf), and previously unreported:We reveal 'Patternz', a global mass surveillance system that harvests digital advertising data on behalf of 'national security agencies'.Patternz is operated by a company based in Israel and/or Singapore. It claims to collect data about 5 billion users from 87 ad exchanges and SSPs via 6 data centers around the world.Thread:

item.title: Earl K. Miller
item.description: I spelled Kari Hoffman wrong. Sorry, Kari.

item.title: Open Ephys
item.description:
1/3 In case you missed the Open Ephys SfN booth this year, here are the designs for our Blinkenbrain chaotic key chain swag: https://github.com/open-ephys/blinkenbrain
It's a smooth-brained, analog, chaotic (in the formal sense) blinky!

item.title: Open Ephys
item.description: 2/3 It has an analog, 2 transistor, chaotic attractor that drives an LED.

item.title: Open Ephys
item.description: 3/3 And, yes, our swag came with a datasheet ü§ì. Already looking forward to next year's art project...
